question.title: What will the United States score on the 2025 Corruption Perceptions Index?
question.description:
Every year, [Transparency International](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transparency_International) releases an updated version of its [Corruption Perceptions Index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corruption_Perceptions_Index), a global index and ranking of every country in the world based on their perceived levels of [public-sector corruption](https://www.transparency.org/en/news/how-cpi-scores-are-calculated). Countries are scored on a scale from 0 (most corrupt) to 100 (least corrupt, also referred to as most transparent).

In 2024, Denmark [scored the highest](https://www.transparency.org/en/cpi/2024) on the Corruption Perceptions Index, with a score of 90. Lowest was South Sudan, with a score of 8. The United States tied the Bahamas at 28th in the rankings, with a score of 65. That marked the U.S.'s [lowest-ever score on the index](https://www.transparency.org/en/cpi/2024/index/usa) since the 100-point scale was adopted in 2012.
question.resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the score of the United States on the [2025 Corruption Perceptions Index](https://www.transparency.org/en/cpi), as published by Transparency International.
question.fine_print: If the 2025 Corruption Perceptions Index is not published before May 1, 2026, or if it is published but not on a 100-point scale, this question will be annulled.
question.short_title: What will U.S. score on 2025 Corruption Perceptions Index?

results.title: Will Iceland pass a referendum to resume EU membership negotiations before 2028?
results.short_title: Iceland passes EU membership referendum by 2028?
results.url_title: Iceland passes EU membership referendum by 2028?

question.title: Will Iceland pass a referendum to resume EU membership negotiations before 2028?
question.description:
Although Iceland applied to join the European Union (EU) in [2009](http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/8153139.stm), the application was suspended in 2013. Since then there have been talks of resuming, but this time under the mandate of a public referendum. In 2026, the foreign minister of Iceland [announced](https://www.ruv.is/english/2026-01-09-referendum-on-eu-accession-talks-likely-in-spring-2027-463292) that a parliamentary resolution to hold a referendum would be presented during spring of 2026. If approved, it is expected that this referendum would be held in spring 2027.

Public opinion on Icelandic relations with the EU has differed through the years, but currently appears to be more positive than negative. Polls on the topic are collated on [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iceland%E2%80%93European_Union_relations#Public_opinion).
question.resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as Yes if Icelandic voters approve a referendum to hold negotiations with the European Union on the topic of Icelandic membership in the European Union before January 1, 2028.

If a referendum is held and voters do not approve it, and no further referenda on the topic are scheduled before January 1, 2028, this question will immediately resolve as No.
question.short_title: Iceland passes EU membership referendum by 2028?

question.title: What will the first reported earnings per share after December 2025 be for the following companies? (MSFT)
question.description:
[Earnings per share](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/e/eps.asp) (EPS) is a financial metric that measures a company's profit per outstanding share of common stock. It's calculated by dividing a company's net income by its total number of outstanding shares. EPS is considered one of the most important variables in determining a stock's value and is commonly used by investors to assess a company's profitability.

As of December 2025, Apple, Nvidia, Microsoft, Amazon, AMD, Tesla, and Meta are among the largest companies [by market cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/) in the world. Their EPS in the last four quarters have been:

* [Apple](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/aapl/apple/eps-earnings-per-share-diluted): \$2.40, \$1.65, \$1.57, \$1.85
* [AMD](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/amd/amd/eps-earnings-per-share-diluted): \$0.30, \$0.44, \$0.54, \$0.75
* [Amazon](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/amzn/amazon/eps-earnings-per-share-diluted): \$1.86, \$1.59, \$1.68, \$1.95
* [Meta](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/meta/meta-platforms/eps-earnings-per-share-diluted): \$7.96, \$6.43, \$7.14, \$1.05 (due to a one-time tax charge)
* [Microsoft](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/msft/microsoft/eps-earnings-per-share-diluted): \$3.23, \$3.46, \$3.65, \$3.72
* [Nvidia](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/nvda/nvidia/eps-earnings-per-share-diluted): \$0.89, \$0.75, \$1.08, \$1.3
* [Tesla](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/tsla/tesla/eps-earnings-per-share-diluted):  \$0.59, \$0.12, \$0.33, \$0.39

\[Subquestions on more of the above companies will be added throughout the quarter.]

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":41334,"question_id":41251}}`
question.resolution_criteria:
This question is a subquestion of a group question. This subquestion specifically pertains to (and resolves according to) the option 'MSFT'. The resolution criteria for the parent question is below. 

Each subquestion will resolve as the GAAP diluted EPS reported in each company's first official quarterly earnings release after December 30, 2025. This is expected to be

* the Q1 FY2026 report for Apple (released around January 29)
* the Q4 FY2025 report for AMD (released February 3)
* the Q4 FY2025 report for Amazon (released February 5)
* the Q4 FY2025 report for Meta (released February 4)
* the Q2 FY2026 report for Microsoft (released February 4)
* the Q4 FY2025 report for Tesla (released February 4)

The earnings reports are typically released on the respective companies' investor relations websites and filed with the [U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC)](https://www.sec.gov/search-filings) as a Form 8-K.
question.fine_print:
* If multiple earnings reports are released, the first report encompassing the entirety of the previous quarter will be used.
* Only the initially reported figures will be considered‚Äîany subsequent revisions, corrections, or restatements will not affect resolution.
* If a company does not publicly report earnings after December 31, 2025 and before April 1, 2026 or if it ceases to operate, that specific subquestion will be **annulled**.
* If a company announces a stock split, the reported EPS figure will be adjusted to reflect pre-split values.

This question's resolution criteria (fine print, background info, etc) is synced with an [original identical question](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/41334) which opened on 2026-01-09 21:00:00. This question will resolve based on the stated resolution criteria and fine print. However, if this question would resolve differently than the original question, then this question will be annulled. Additionally, if the original question's resolution could have been known before this question opened, then this question will be annulled.

question.title: What will the first reported revenues after December 2025 be for the following companies? (MSFT)
question.description:
As of December 2025, Apple, Nvidia, Microsoft, Amazon, AMD, Tesla, and Meta are among the 7 largest companies [by market cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/) in the world. Their revenues in the last four quarters have been:

* [Apple](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/AAPL/apple/revenue): \$124,300m, \$95,359m, \$94,036m, \$102,466m
* [AMD](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/amd/amd/revenue): \$7,658m, \$7,438m, \$7,685m, \$9,246m
* [Amazon](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/amzn/amazon/revenue): \$187,792m, \$155,667m, \$167,701m, \$180,169m
* [Meta](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/Meta/meta-platforms/revenue): \$48,386m, \$42,314m, \$47,516m, \$51,242m
* [Microsoft](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/MSFT/microsoft/revenue): \$69,632m, \$70,066m, \$76,441m, \$77,673m
* [Nvidia](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/NVDA/nvidia/revenue): \$39,331m, \$44,062m, \$46,473m, \$57,006m
* [Tesla](https://www.macrotrends.net/stocks/charts/tsla/tesla/revenue): \$25,707m, \$19,335m, \$22,496m, \$28,095m

\[Subquestions on more of the above companies will be added throughout the quarter.]

results.title: Will the United States attack Colombia before 2027?

question.title: Will the United States attack Colombia before 2027?
question.description:
In September 2025, the United States added Colombia to a list of nations [failing to cooperate in the drug war](https://apnews.com/article/trump-colombia-drug-war-cooperation-14493c8f7a9af102a8a29cc368ac1e03) for the first time in almost 30 years. The designation led to a slashing of US assistance to the country. [The Trump administration also imposed sanctions](https://apnews.com/article/trump-colombia-petro-sanctions-drug-trafficking-1b6ead338ec266b3df40859db6ee2d8d) in October 2025 on President Gustavo Petro, his family and a member of his government over accusations of involvement in the global drug trade.

On January 5, 2026, US President [Donald J. Trump](https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/trump-says-new-military-operation-focused-colombia-sounds-good-him-2026-01-05/) told reporters aboard Air Force One that military action against Colombia's government "sounds good to me":

> "Colombia is very sick, too, run by a sick man, who likes making cocaine and selling it to the United States, and he's not going to be doing it very long," Trump told reporters... in an apparent reference to Colombia's President.

Colombia‚Äôs outspoken left-wing President has responded to the US capture of [Venezuelan President Nicol√°s Maduro](https://apnews.com/article/venezuela-maduro-capture-trump-attack-military-ceb21da088f0a06b1813e66922def9a3) by escalating his [spiraling war of words with the US President](https://apnews.com/article/colombia-petro-trump-venezuela-maduro-eaf98a41ae427a2d218910606a6fa3e0), stating it was an ‚Äúabhorrent‚Äù violation of [Latin American sovereignty](https://apnews.com/photo-gallery/trump-venezuela-cuba-colombia-mexico-imperialism-600f77e9930aaf6cd856b4a384c51287). He also suggested it was committed by "enslavers" and constituted a "spectacle of death" comparable to Nazi Germany‚Äôs 1937 carpet bombing of Guernica, Spain.

Despite this, just days later the [US President abruptly changed](https://apnews.com/article/trump-colombia-venezuela-petro-610cfdb86d38544712c3f673639845e1) his tone stating the two Presidents had exchanged a friendly phone call and he had invited the Colombian President to the White House.

[The two countries have a historic alliance](https://apnews.com/article/colombia-petro-trump-venezuela-maduro-eaf98a41ae427a2d218910606a6fa3e0) but political tensions remain.

> For Colombia, the U.S. remains key to the military‚Äôs fight against leftist guerrillas and drug traffickers. Washington has provided Bogot√° with roughly \$14 billion in the last two decades.

> For the U.S., Colombia remains the cornerstone of its counternarcotics strategy abroad, providing crucial intelligence used [to interdict drugs in the Caribbean](https://apnews.com/article/only-on-ap-smuggling-30c3e97599eb4b859ca575c58baab4ef).
question.resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, after January 13, 2026 and before January 1, 2027, the United States of America carries out an attack against Colombia's territory or military forces, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
question.fine_print:
* To qualify for this question, the attack must physically affect Colombian territory or military forces: cyberattacks or other actions without immediate physical impact will not count.
* For the purpose of this question, Colombia's territory refers to its land and internal waters. External waters such as territorial waters will not count.
* The peaceful presence of U.S. troops or personnel in Colombia with the assent of Colombia's government will not cause this question to resolve as Yes.
* The U.S. need not initiate a conflict in order for the question to resolve as Yes.
